name: Vijayaraghavan Srinivasan
headline: CFO at PT Cipta Busana Jaya
summary: - Chartered Accountant (ACA/CPA) and Cost and Management Accountant (ACMA) - 19 years in Indonesia ; Initial 9 years in India. - Fluent in Bahasa Indonesia language ; - Indonesian Accounting, Taxation and Audit; Handled tax court cases. - Worked in SAP and Oracle applications environment. Implemented ERP applications. - Business planning and Business development. - Costing in manufacturing and service business. - Funding arrangements. Term loans. Banking relationship in Indonesia. - Forex risk management and corporate risk management. - Systems : SOP, Process flow improvements. - Export coordination - Shipping, Insurance and commercial negotiation. - HR and labor laws in Indonesia - New business development - Corporate compliance - Legal, Taxation and Secretarial.

exp_title3: CFO and Dep Director-Finance and Business Development
exp_summary3: Significant Achievements : -Arrangement of Term loan for new companies and new projects. -Arrangement of banking facilities for existing group companies. -Championed a task force to reduce Receivables. -Finalized distributorship agreement with the principal on favorable terms.
exp_summary4: Significant Achievements : -Secured approvals – BKPM, Ministry of Trade and MOLHR. -Statutory compliances in all functional areas. No single instance of delay or non compliance.. -Finalised statutory audit in 3 weeks of financial year close. -Arrangement of term loan from banks at the most competitive rates. -Obtained Insurance premium rates comparable to the best in the Industry. -Tax audit finalisation and tax refunds.100% success rate in tax objection and court cases. -Inducted into the Board of Directors within a short span of 15 months.
exp_summary5: Significant Achievements : -Forex gain of Usd 60k in Forward Cover Management. -Savings of USD 100k in freight Cost benchmarking with competition in 2004-05 & 2005-06. -Accomplished Insurance premium reductions of USD 16k; Claims received USD 120k. -Material balancing and waste control reporting system designed, critical to textile industry. -Export document monitoring system developed for faster collections, reducing interest costs. -MIS report generations and management in Oracle Financials environment. -Actively implemented system21 financial module of ERP. -Implemented Profit enhancing Product Mix Strategies on a monthly basis. -“star performer” with the highest performance pay among the peer group
exp_summary6: Significant Achievements : -Handled Anti-Dumping cases. Achieved Dumping Duty reduction in the Turkey and EU cases. -Demurrage Savings of USD 18k in Project clearances. -Cost sheets developed for various product categories. -Coordinated the CODA Financial System implementation. -Enhanced reporting system to improve the cycle time in document negotiation with banks.
exp_summary7: Significant Achievements : -Obtained Sales Tax exemptions. Obtained exemption of Rs. 55 million. -Active Team Leader for ISO 9000 certification. Certification received in the shortest time. -Championed “Towards Zero Inventory” project and achieved significant success. -Promoted as Divisional Finance Manager for support Division; Youngest to report to the CEO. -Obtained best “suggestion award” in the internal competition, savings in communication cost. -Implemented Symix ERP system in Support division.

name: Satyanarayanan Seshadri
headline: Assistant Professor at Indian Institute of Technology, Madras
summary: Working on technology and market development of cleaner sources of heating in process industries. These include solar heating and high temperature heat pumps. Actively seeking partners to accelerate electrification of process heating with solar back-up, especially those less than 95 C

Benefits of joining are, you can: 1) Establish connectivity with professionals internationally from industry, investors, government bodies and research bases who share an interest in research, innovation, R&D project financing, EU Funding, IPR management, knowledge transfer and science communication. 2) Stay informed of developments in Horizon 2020. 3) Raise questions and issues for open discussion and debates. This may for example be a specific question on the rules of FP7 and Horizon 2020 or even a open debate on a wider socio-economic issue relating to the adoption of new and emerging technologies. 4) Share insights, best practices and your experiences with others. 5) Find new R&D and technology partners and investors. Partner and investor search posts are welcomed. If you have a technology to offer or are seeking a new technological capability, you are welcomed to post. 6) Post and share news be that news about your company or other R&D and innovation related articles. Of particular interest to the group are topics such as: * Innovative Monetization techniques - advertising, affiliates, subscriptions, memberships, marketplaces, lead-gen, etc). * Social Media Marketing - social networks, Twitter, online video, etc. * Off-The-Shelf and Open Source Platforms content management systems and development environments. * Virtual Companies - distributed teams, freelancing, offices-of-convenience and outsourcing. * Cloud Computing - low-overhead, flexible, on-demand infrastructure. * Social and Mobile as marketing, delivery and monetization platforms. What kind of events do we host? * The Entrepreneurs Forum. Monthly, with 80-100 attendees, 20-30 of whom give short (60-second) pitches. This is followed by pizza/networking and a headline panel in which successful bootstrapped entrepreneurs talk about a topic of interest to founders of ultra light startups. * The Legal Roundtable. Monthly, with 30-50 attendees. A panel of "ultra light friendly" lawyers answer questions on legal topics of interest to tech entrepreneurs, including Corporate Formation, Financing, Intellectual Property, and Immigration/International Topics. exp_summary1: Nurturing young minds to appreciate and enjoy technology development in the fields of energy, emissions and energy policy. Super cool technology development for transforming process plant heating efficiency. Enabling industries to formulate policies and deploy solutions with lowest LACE (Levelized Avoided Cost of Energy). Enabling clean air with advanced monitoring and control of particulate and gaseous emission form industrial sources
exp_title3: R&D Leader FML Tech Center, IITM Research Park
exp_summary3: Lead & Manage the Chennai R&D center Guide product and technology development activities for Forbes Marshall in the areas of combustion, steam instrumentation and control systems Develop strategic and collaborative relationship with IITM and other academic institutes enabling technology transfer and fundamental research in the areas of interest to FM
exp_summary4: - Thermodynamic efficiency and performance estimations, payback, NPV and ROI calculations for projects on energy efficiency improvements through waste heat recovery, CHP type installations, biomass and solar thermal power generation - Design, specification and commissioning of experimental test facilities for conducting validation studies in sprays, atomization, mixing and heat transfer - Energy recovery pilot plant design and spec. - Technology and market assessment for Solar thermal energy generation and cooling technologies - New product development for inhalation drug delivery and advanced refrigeration concepts
exp_summary5: Worked on inhalation drug delivery device characterization and optimization. Designed and patented a new particle capture device that uses electrostatic methods
exp_summary6: Graduate research assistant at the Aerosol Technology Lab: Focused on solid and liquid particle separation from air streams, air pollution control, biological aerosol characterization, prototype development and testing, test aerosol generation and conditioning
exp_summary7: Accelerator tech is a technology company, operating in niche areas like super-conductivity and High-energy physics. I was working here to conceptualize and develop a powder-processing pilot plant to enable manufacture of superconducting wires and cables. Prototype models from my PhD research was scaled up and commercialized at Acc Tech. My job function involved talking to customers, vendors and other stake holders to design and commission this facility and demonstrate capability. Funding for this start-up venture was raised from DOE's SBIR and STTR grants

name: Vijayaraghavan Srinivasan
headline: CFO at PT Cipta Busana Jaya
summary: - Chartered Accountant (ACA/CPA) and Cost and Management Accountant (ACMA) - 19 years in Indonesia ; Initial 9 years in India. - Fluent in Bahasa Indonesia language ; - Indonesian Accounting, Taxation and Audit; Handled tax court cases. - Worked in SAP and Oracle applications environment. Implemented ERP applications. - Business planning and Business development. - Costing in manufacturing and service business. - Funding arrangements. Term loans. Banking relationship in Indonesia. - Forex risk management and corporate risk management. - Systems : SOP, Process flow improvements. - Export coordination - Shipping, Insurance and commercial negotiation. - HR and labor laws in Indonesia - New business development - Corporate compliance - Legal, Taxation and Secretarial.

exp_title3: CFO and Dep Director-Finance and Business Development
exp_summary3: Significant Achievements : -Arrangement of Term loan for new companies and new projects. -Arrangement of banking facilities for existing group companies. -Championed a task force to reduce Receivables. -Finalized distributorship agreement with the principal on favorable terms.
exp_summary4: Significant Achievements : -Secured approvals – BKPM, Ministry of Trade and MOLHR. -Statutory compliances in all functional areas. No single instance of delay or non compliance.. -Finalised statutory audit in 3 weeks of financial year close. -Arrangement of term loan from banks at the most competitive rates. -Obtained Insurance premium rates comparable to the best in the Industry. -Tax audit finalisation and tax refunds.100% success rate in tax objection and court cases. -Inducted into the Board of Directors within a short span of 15 months.
exp_summary5: Significant Achievements : -Forex gain of Usd 60k in Forward Cover Management. -Savings of USD 100k in freight Cost benchmarking with competition in 2004-05 & 2005-06. -Accomplished Insurance premium reductions of USD 16k; Claims received USD 120k. -Material balancing and waste control reporting system designed, critical to textile industry. -Export document monitoring system developed for faster collections, reducing interest costs. -MIS report generations and management in Oracle Financials environment. -Actively implemented system21 financial module of ERP. -Implemented Profit enhancing Product Mix Strategies on a monthly basis. -“star performer” with the highest performance pay among the peer group
exp_summary6: Significant Achievements : -Handled Anti-Dumping cases. Achieved Dumping Duty reduction in the Turkey and EU cases. -Demurrage Savings of USD 18k in Project clearances. -Cost sheets developed for various product categories. -Coordinated the CODA Financial System implementation. -Enhanced reporting system to improve the cycle time in document negotiation with banks.
exp_summary7: Significant Achievements : -Obtained Sales Tax exemptions. Obtained exemption of Rs. 55 million. -Active Team Leader for ISO 9000 certification. Certification received in the shortest time. -Championed “Towards Zero Inventory” project and achieved significant success. -Promoted as Divisional Finance Manager for support Division; Youngest to report to the CEO. -Obtained best “suggestion award” in the internal competition, savings in communication cost. -Implemented Symix ERP system in Support division.

RPA represents a tremendous opportunity for organizations to increase performance, improve productivity, decrease costs, among a plethora of other benefits. The benefits from RPA are immediate, plentiful, and significant—and can be grouped into 3 core areas: 1.	Improved Employee and Customer Satisfaction 2.	Accelerated Productivity Gains 3.	Enhanced Compliance RPA also has wide applicability across the organizations, including Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Customer Service, Compliance, and IT/MIS. It includes cyber-physical systems, A.I. (Artificial Intelligence), the IoT (Internet of Things), 3D printing, Cloud Computing, Blockchain networks, nanotechnology, biotechnology, automation/robotics, and other emerging Digital Transformation technologies. Industry 4.0 creates what has been called a "smart factory." Within the modular structured smart factories, cyber-physical systems monitor physical processes, create a virtual copy of the physical world and make decentralized decisions. Over the Internet of Things, cyber-physical systems communicate and cooperate with each other and with humans in real time, and via the Internet of Services, both internal and cross-organizational services are offered and used by participants of the Value Chain. <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=82279&goback=, group_name:-Enterprise Risk Management, no_of_members:-31102, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/2/000/018/332/270d026.png, group_id:-82279, group_description:-This is a group for all those interested in truly managing risk strategically, comprehensively and effectively. Nearly 55,000 telecom professionals have joined one or more of our 10 CrossConnects groups, including four geographically aligned groups for Sales Professionals. Telecom Tigers is our Flagship group with over 30,000 members We started with simple goals: Operating with integrity and transparency, • Enhancing and accelerating the ability of professionals like you to connect with a larger network of peers. • Maintaining a fidelity to the Telecom and Wireless industries • Developing the trust of the Group Manager community here on LinkedIn. Assessing emerging risks, data analytics, cyber security, critical thinking, industry insights, modern techniques, global internal auditing standards, etc. will be amongst the topics discussed at the sessions which will be comprised of panels of industry & subject matter experts. EXPECTATION MANAGEMENT & THE WAY FORWARD - through panel discussion of local & global professionals To set the theme, the keynote speaker Richard Chambers, President & CEO, IIA Inc. would speak on TheInternal Auditor of tomorrow – what to expect. Hal Garyn, Senior VP, IIA Inc., will cover recent changes to the International Professional Practices Framework(IPPF). The other sessions will be mainly panels comprising of national & global professionals discussing case studies and best practices. International delegates from Middle East, South East Asia, etc. are also expected. TOPICS TO STAY RELEVANT As internal auditors, we need to keep ourselves abreast of global internal auditing standards, international practices in Internal Auditing, local industry insights, and emerging new areas of risks. The technical sessions will be around the following areas Cyber security, forensics and fraud, Data analytics, monitoring and predictability We hope to make this a “not to be missed” event in Internal Audit. exp_summary1: Lead and manage business consulting assignments for clients in India, Sri Lanka and Africa in operations, analytics and go-to-market readiness and strategy. Collaborate with CxOs to develop integrated business and operating strategies that create sustainable value. Develop a strong cross functional team with deep sector and solution expertise. Build sales pipeline, win and execute projects.
exp_summary2: Led business consulting and process improvement assignments for clients in India, Middle East, and Japan Provided expertise and advice on market entry strategies for PE and E-commerce firms Project managed lean operations consulting assignments Piloted as a thought leader and provided expertise on analytics assignments
exp_summary3: Analyzed strategic roadmap in the areas of technology, operations, sales and marketing and assurance to assess effectiveness of implementation Engaged with the CxOs to improve and enhance business processes and performance Performed cost benefit analysis and effectiveness of investments against actual
exp_summary4: Worked as a subject matter expert to internal and external stakeholders in the telecom analytics space to increase efficiency and add value to client engagements Managed projects on process improvements for North American telecom clients
exp_summary5: Led and executed business consulting assignments in West Africa and India in the telecom advisory space Reviewed processes, learned new systems, evaluated risks and provide expertise on enhancement opportunities Engaged with business heads/CxO to create sustainable processes Managed and led proposals responses, assessing client needs and creating final proposal and design in-line with the firm strategy Handled proposal status, de-brief, and subsequent preparation for all the bid deals.

name: Satyanarayanan Seshadri
headline: Assistant Professor at Indian Institute of Technology, Madras
summary: Working on technology and market development of cleaner sources of heating in process industries. These include solar heating and high temperature heat pumps. Actively seeking partners to accelerate electrification of process heating with solar back-up, especially those less than 95 C

exp_summary1: Nurturing young minds to appreciate and enjoy technology development in the fields of energy, emissions and energy policy. Super cool technology development for transforming process plant heating efficiency. Enabling industries to formulate policies and deploy solutions with lowest LACE (Levelized Avoided Cost of Energy). Enabling clean air with advanced monitoring and control of particulate and gaseous emission form industrial sources
exp_title3: R&D Leader FML Tech Center, IITM Research Park
exp_summary3: Lead & Manage the Chennai R&D center Guide product and technology development activities for Forbes Marshall in the areas of combustion, steam instrumentation and control systems Develop strategic and collaborative relationship with IITM and other academic institutes enabling technology transfer and fundamental research in the areas of interest to FM
exp_summary4: - Thermodynamic efficiency and performance estimations, payback, NPV and ROI calculations for projects on energy efficiency improvements through waste heat recovery, CHP type installations, biomass and solar thermal power generation - Design, specification and commissioning of experimental test facilities for conducting validation studies in sprays, atomization, mixing and heat transfer - Energy recovery pilot plant design and spec. - Technology and market assessment for Solar thermal energy generation and cooling technologies - New product development for inhalation drug delivery and advanced refrigeration concepts
exp_summary5: Worked on inhalation drug delivery device characterization and optimization. Designed and patented a new particle capture device that uses electrostatic methods
exp_summary6: Graduate research assistant at the Aerosol Technology Lab: Focused on solid and liquid particle separation from air streams, air pollution control, biological aerosol characterization, prototype development and testing, test aerosol generation and conditioning
exp_summary7: Accelerator tech is a technology company, operating in niche areas like super-conductivity and High-energy physics. I was working here to conceptualize and develop a powder-processing pilot plant to enable manufacture of superconducting wires and cables. Prototype models from my PhD research was scaled up and commercialized at Acc Tech. My job function involved talking to customers, vendors and other stake holders to design and commission this facility and demonstrate capability. Funding for this start-up venture was raised from DOE's SBIR and STTR grants

exp_title3: CFO and Dep Director-Finance and Business Development
exp_summary3: Significant Achievements : -Arrangement of Term loan for new companies and new projects. -Arrangement of banking facilities for existing group companies. -Championed a task force to reduce Receivables. -Finalized distributorship agreement with the principal on favorable terms.
exp_summary4: Significant Achievements : -Secured approvals – BKPM, Ministry of Trade and MOLHR. -Statutory compliances in all functional areas. No single instance of delay or non compliance.. -Finalised statutory audit in 3 weeks of financial year close. -Arrangement of term loan from banks at the most competitive rates. -Obtained Insurance premium rates comparable to the best in the Industry. -Tax audit finalisation and tax refunds.100% success rate in tax objection and court cases. -Inducted into the Board of Directors within a short span of 15 months.
exp_summary5: Significant Achievements : -Forex gain of Usd 60k in Forward Cover Management. -Savings of USD 100k in freight Cost benchmarking with competition in 2004-05 & 2005-06. -Accomplished Insurance premium reductions of USD 16k; Claims received USD 120k. -Material balancing and waste control reporting system designed, critical to textile industry. -Export document monitoring system developed for faster collections, reducing interest costs. -MIS report generations and management in Oracle Financials environment. -Actively implemented system21 financial module of ERP. -Implemented Profit enhancing Product Mix Strategies on a monthly basis. -“star performer” with the highest performance pay among the peer group
exp_summary6: Significant Achievements : -Handled Anti-Dumping cases. Achieved Dumping Duty reduction in the Turkey and EU cases. -Demurrage Savings of USD 18k in Project clearances. -Cost sheets developed for various product categories. -Coordinated the CODA Financial System implementation. -Enhanced reporting system to improve the cycle time in document negotiation with banks.
exp_summary7: Significant Achievements : -Obtained Sales Tax exemptions. Obtained exemption of Rs. 55 million. -Active Team Leader for ISO 9000 certification. Certification received in the shortest time. -Championed “Towards Zero Inventory” project and achieved significant success. -Promoted as Divisional Finance Manager for support Division; Youngest to report to the CEO. -Obtained best “suggestion award” in the internal competition, savings in communication cost. -Implemented Symix ERP system in Support division.

This group is brought to you by Telecoms Tech and IoT Tech - The online resources for news, blogs, strategy and opinion from around the global telecoms and IoT industries - www.telecomstechnews.com www.telecomsevents.com www.iottechnews.com www.iotevents.org <> group_link:-https://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=37987&goback=, group_name:-Lean Six Sigma, no_of_members:-602835, group_logo:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAANKAAAAJDljM2U4NGZkLTFkMTMtNDRiYi1hYWY2LWViZWRhNGUwZTA0Mw.png, group_id:-37987, group_description:-We are joining together to network, to learn, to develop business, Jobs, careers, certification opportunities, to participate in best practice sharing, and maintain & build new relationships. We are a global community, uniting all White Belt (WB), Yellow Belt (YB), Green Belt (GB), Project Managers (PM), Black Belt (BB), Master Back Belt (MBB), Project Sponsor (PS), Deployment Champion (DC), Executive Leader (EL), Kaizen Practitioner or Facilitator or Lean Master, Auditors, Continuous Improvement, Management Consultants, Program Managers, Business Owners, Students, Professors, & Engineers. We are Lean Six Sigma Professionals, Practitioners, & students of Lean Six Sigma, Lean, Six Sigma, Operational Excellence, TQPI, Business Process Management, business analyst, BPM, Kaizen, TPS, Project Management, Change Management, Strategy, Supply Chain, Innovation, Quality Control, ISO, SCOR, TRIZ, Theory of Constraints, ToC, ITIL, CMMI, Malcolm Baldrige, TQM, Total Quality Management, Industrial Engineers, BPM, & Process Excellence. We are a central hub for author’s books, articles, white papers, podcasts, blogs, events and conferences. Consultants, and thought leaders are visiting regularly to support members in projects, productivity, training, skills development, coaching, mentoring, financials, statistical software, simulation, teams, organizational development, and more…. We practice in every Industry and have private subgroups for special topics such as Healthcare, Private Sector, Jobs, BPM, Information Technology, Kaizen, & Operational Excellence I am the Lean Six Sigma Group Founder and welcome your contribution to the community. exp_summary1: Lead and manage business consulting assignments for clients in India, Sri Lanka and Africa in operations, analytics and go-to-market readiness and strategy. Collaborate with CxOs to develop integrated business and operating strategies that create sustainable value. Develop a strong cross functional team with deep sector and solution expertise. Build sales pipeline, win and execute projects.
exp_summary2: Led business consulting and process improvement assignments for clients in India, Middle East, and Japan Provided expertise and advice on market entry strategies for PE and E-commerce firms Project managed lean operations consulting assignments Piloted as a thought leader and provided expertise on analytics assignments
exp_summary3: Analyzed strategic roadmap in the areas of technology, operations, sales and marketing and assurance to assess effectiveness of implementation Engaged with the CxOs to improve and enhance business processes and performance Performed cost benefit analysis and effectiveness of investments against actual
exp_summary4: Worked as a subject matter expert to internal and external stakeholders in the telecom analytics space to increase efficiency and add value to client engagements Managed projects on process improvements for North American telecom clients
exp_summary5: Led and executed business consulting assignments in West Africa and India in the telecom advisory space Reviewed processes, learned new systems, evaluated risks and provide expertise on enhancement opportunities Engaged with business heads/CxO to create sustainable processes Managed and led proposals responses, assessing client needs and creating final proposal and design in-line with the firm strategy Handled proposal status, de-brief, and subsequent preparation for all the bid deals.

name: Satyanarayanan Seshadri
headline: Assistant Professor at Indian Institute of Technology, Madras
summary: Working on technology and market development of cleaner sources of heating in process industries. These include solar heating and high temperature heat pumps. Actively seeking partners to accelerate electrification of process heating with solar back-up, especially those less than 95 C

This may for example be a specific question on the rules of FP7 and Horizon 2020 or even a open debate on a wider socio-economic issue relating to the adoption of new and emerging technologies. 4) Share insights, best practices and your experiences with others. 5) Find new R&D and technology partners and investors. Partner and investor search posts are welcomed. If you have a technology to offer or are seeking a new technological capability, you are welcomed to post. 6) Post and share news be that news about your company or other R&D and innovation related articles. Unlike other events where providers talk about technology, Footprints presents success stories directly from people who have implemented climate change actions in their manufacturing units. The objective is to learn from their experiences and replicate their success stories. Why Climate Change Action is important? According to the latest IPCC report, the GHG emissions (from burning fossil fuels) have to be reduced to 50% within our life time (2050) and 0% within our children’s life time (2100). That is, if we wish to avoid the catastrophic consequences to our economies, civilization, humanity and to the millions of species on Earth. Of particular interest to the group are topics such as: * Innovative Monetization techniques - advertising, affiliates, subscriptions, memberships, marketplaces, lead-gen, etc). * Social Media Marketing - social networks, Twitter, online video, etc. * Off-The-Shelf and Open Source Platforms content management systems and development environments. * Virtual Companies - distributed teams, freelancing, offices-of-convenience and outsourcing. * Cloud Computing - low-overhead, flexible, on-demand infrastructure. * Social and Mobile as marketing, delivery and monetization platforms. What kind of events do we host? * The Entrepreneurs Forum. Monthly, with 80-100 attendees, 20-30 of whom give short (60-second) pitches. This is followed by pizza/networking and a headline panel in which successful bootstrapped entrepreneurs talk about a topic of interest to founders of ultra light startups. * The Legal Roundtable. Monthly, with 30-50 attendees. A panel of "ultra light friendly" lawyers answer questions on legal topics of interest to tech entrepreneurs, including Corporate Formation, Financing, Intellectual Property, and Immigration/International Topics. exp_summary1: Nurturing young minds to appreciate and enjoy technology development in the fields of energy, emissions and energy policy. Super cool technology development for transforming process plant heating efficiency. Enabling industries to formulate policies and deploy solutions with lowest LACE (Levelized Avoided Cost of Energy). Enabling clean air with advanced monitoring and control of particulate and gaseous emission form industrial sources
exp_title3: R&D Leader FML Tech Center, IITM Research Park
exp_summary3: Lead & Manage the Chennai R&D center Guide product and technology development activities for Forbes Marshall in the areas of combustion, steam instrumentation and control systems Develop strategic and collaborative relationship with IITM and other academic institutes enabling technology transfer and fundamental research in the areas of interest to FM
exp_summary4: - Thermodynamic efficiency and performance estimations, payback, NPV and ROI calculations for projects on energy efficiency improvements through waste heat recovery, CHP type installations, biomass and solar thermal power generation - Design, specification and commissioning of experimental test facilities for conducting validation studies in sprays, atomization, mixing and heat transfer - Energy recovery pilot plant design and spec. - Technology and market assessment for Solar thermal energy generation and cooling technologies - New product development for inhalation drug delivery and advanced refrigeration concepts
exp_summary5: Worked on inhalation drug delivery device characterization and optimization. Designed and patented a new particle capture device that uses electrostatic methods
exp_summary6: Graduate research assistant at the Aerosol Technology Lab: Focused on solid and liquid particle separation from air streams, air pollution control, biological aerosol characterization, prototype development and testing, test aerosol generation and conditioning
exp_summary7: Accelerator tech is a technology company, operating in niche areas like super-conductivity and High-energy physics. I was working here to conceptualize and develop a powder-processing pilot plant to enable manufacture of superconducting wires and cables. Prototype models from my PhD research was scaled up and commercialized at Acc Tech. My job function involved talking to customers, vendors and other stake holders to design and commission this facility and demonstrate capability. Funding for this start-up venture was raised from DOE's SBIR and STTR grants

headline: User Interface Software Engineer (Computational Biology) at The MathWorks
summary: * Application Developer with expertise in GUI development in JavaScript, HTML5, Dojo Toolkit, Java and Java Swing. Over 8 years of experience developing User Interfaces for a wide range of domains at EMC, Motorola Inc, Ambient Corp and The MathWorks. * Experience Designing and Developing UI’s for complex workflows with strong emphasis on Usability. * Proficient in SDLC, UI Design and Development, MVC Architecture. * I currently work as a User Interface Developer for the SimBiology Software Development Group at The MathWorks; primarily focused on developing User Interfaces that guide users through workflows that allow them to model, simulate, and analyze dynamic systems. * Skills: JavaScript, React, Redux, React Native, HTML5 , Dojo Toolkit, Java, Java Swing, MATLAB.

exp_title1: User Interface Software Engineer (SimBiology Software Development Group)
exp_summary1: Currently Involved with design and development of the SimBiology Analysis App using JavaScript, HTML, Dojo and Dgrid conforming to SDLC and AGILE methodologies. Developed an On Demand Pageable Table infrastructure to display large datasets containing over 300,000 rows. Primary responsibilities include designing and developing User Interfaces in JavaScript to simplify building, simulation and analyzing Pharmacokinetic (PK) and Pharmacodynamic (PD) models. Designed and developed features for the SimBiology Desktop using Java Swing, MATLAB and the JIDE Software Library Using JProfiler analyzed project load performance and made improvements which reduced time to load for projects by 76%
exp_summary2: Developed over 12 features for the Ambient NMS in Java/Java Swing, Hibernate and MySQL Worked on a developing a next generation client, focusing on a data driven approach to build the User Interface without the need to write any additional code for supporting new MIB (Management Information Base) objects Implemented real time charts for monitoring devices with a focus on uptime and speed using the JideSoft library
exp_summary3: Involved with developing features on both the Client and the Server for AXS Vision EMS in Java and Java Swing. Interact with feature requirement and embedded development teams to implement features Designed and developed infrastructure to streamline creation of Reports and Configuration Pages as API’s and to be Data Driven leading to a 40% reduction in code Implemented Generic Validation Infrastructures to validate and flag invalid fields
exp_summary4: Designed and Implemented multiple GUI components in Java Swing in the form of API’s and Services Designed and Implemented an API that allowed developers to use both commercial and free charting packages like ChartDirector and JFreeChart through a common interface Worked in a team building a next generation client that adopted the Scrum Agile development process.
exp_summary5: Designed and implemented a generic framework that extends Drag and Drop features to the User Interface using Java Swing, XML and the DOM Parser Designed and implemented a frontend in Java Swing to load debug configurations on the fly Created a script in Perl to automate creation of test language packs used by Developers and QA
exp_summary6: Designed and developed an Image Processing system using Java, for use in Geographical Information Systems using Java Swing

name: Karthik K
headline: Business Analyst
summary: 1) Part of a global team that is responsible for various new Global IT and transformational initiatives - Multiple tasks involving Vendor research, preparing business case, proposal, vendor communications, running the RFP process with vendors, analyzing and normalizing the feedback to get the best technical solution, conduct internal and external meetings with various stakeholders at different stages of the project execution 2) Market research: Responsible for monitoring and forecasting marketing and sales trends and gathering data about consumers, competitors, and market conditions, (Generic, by domain, market competitor comparison, global/regional/country-wise trend analysis, new business opportunities, business report analysis etc) 3) Salesforce.com implementation and management 4) Project Implementation and client engagement 5) Proposal development and high level client presentations 6) Account management 7) Client escalations 8) Client facing and Independently perform the different stages of business development life cycle activities with a high degree of confidence. 9) Use IT, sales and marketing databases with a high level of comfort for business development, networking and market research 10) Communicate clearly and concisely with a neutral accent, both orally and in writing. Set high standards of professionalism and operate with integrity, being well organized and systematic and exercise tact and judgment in responding to client inquiries and resolving complaints and problems.

Additionally, Karthik was also the project lead on a number of successful key account implementations within APME. <> profile_member_id:-16744862, id:-556141051, name:-Cheron Fan, created_date:-2014-10-10 03:30:04, date_and_relationship:-2014-10-10 03:30:04, worked in different groups, headline:-Associate Director - Implementation, TAPFIN at ManpowerGroup Solutions, profile_url:-https://www.linkedin.com/in/cheronfan/, summary:-I came to know Karthik when I was working as the Solution Architect of the Global Sales team of ManpowerGroup. During that period, Karthik was one of my Asia Pacific regional colleagues that we worked together in supporting several sales pursuits. Karthik always impressed me with his patience in outlining essential details of client requirements and expected deliverables for the team to construct proper solutions and proposals for clients. He rarely complained about workload even I knew that he was one of a few regional colleagues who carried multiple hats and always worked against tight deadlines. Apart from being a supportive pre-sales member, Karthik was instrumental in the Salesforce.com implementation. His expertise of the tool and efforts spent on the respective internal training had significantly reduced challenges along the change management process. The adoption of such a new enterprise-wide CRM was an important milestone of the company and Karthik for sure was one of the key contributors of the success. <> profile_member_id:-1729553, id:-521192263, name:-Zoe Helene, created_date:-2014-09-16 11:52:58, date_and_relationship:-2014-09-16 11:52:58, Zoe managed Karthik, headline:-Multidisciplinary Artist + Cultural Activist + Psychedelic Feminist, profile_url:-https://www.linkedin.com/in/zoehelene/, profile_image:-https://media.licdn.com/media/AAEAAQAAAAAAAAljAAAAJGM3MzhkODk0LTk0ODItNGEwMS1iODY1LTU0N2M0YjgzMTg1Ng.jpg, summary:-It is my pleasure to recommend Karthik, who I thoroughly enjoyed working with. At the time his role was mainly proposal development, market research, and conducting online demonstrations of a complex and robust enterprise software system. At the time these types of systems were still very new, so explaining them meant invented communication skills and a great deal of patience and charm. While the digital revolution has certainly evolved, the fundamentals of the pioneering information technology process we were working to develop and sell remains the foundation for most of what we use every day, including all electronic messaging types, social media interactions and ecommerce transactions. The system was design to handle both inbound and outbound messaging for big brands dealing with huge customer databases, and to keep the continuum of those messages integrated and in order. The objective was to help these companies maintaining one-to-one relationships with clients and/or business partners while at the same time collecting and analyzing coveted information through a patented technology that mined and refined raw syntactical structure data and transformed it into actionable real-time statistics. The company was super face-paced and competitive, and all team members were expected to be high achievers. Even during the most challenging of times, Karthik was only ever friendly, dependable, and smart. Over the years I have also learned that he also has a gift for networking, and maintaining business relations in a highly personable manner. <> profile_member_id:-39071256, id:-49014767, name:-Sam Haggag, created_date:-2013-07-29 19:30:12, date_and_relationship:-2013-07-29 19:30:12, Sam managed Karthik, headline:-A business leader with over 25 years experience in delivering Human Capital solutions in Europe, Asia and Middle East, profile_url:-https://www.linkedin.com/in/sam-haggag-82010211/, profile_image:-https://media.licdn.com/media/p/2/000/03a/0aa/0681ca8.jpg, summary:-I've had the pleasure of working with Karthik for a number of years in my regional sales role and currently in my Experis role. exp_summary1: o Manage and audit heavy flow communications internally and externally o Maintain a log to track multiple global projects and their status o Process high-level confidential and sensitive information o Prepare drafts, comments, reference materials, reports to make an informed decision o Work with multiple stakeholders and prepare relevant materials for everyday meetings and calls o High-level networking with senior global leaders and hosting them appropriately o Part of team that rolled-out many collaborative tools and digital enhancements (Mobile Apps, RWS, SEO) (2014 – 2015) o Assist our CTO in preparing board level and management presentations o Detailed competitor analysis (2012-2016) o Ad-hoc research on many industry pressing topics for top execs (2012 - 2016) o Create relevant marketing brochures (2012 - 2014) o Assist my sales manager on RFP’s, RFQ’s and RFI’s from many Fortune 500 firms (2012 - 2014) o Meet clients for presenting ManpowerGroup and cater to their workforce needs o Collaborate with global majors on identifying their pain-points, solution mapping, due-diligence, implementation plans and project management (2011 - 2014) o Help clients with many complex reporting and design frameworks and concept executions (2012 - 2014) o Liaise with our global sales office and country teams to analyze all sales queries, RFPs, pricing request, pricing (2011 - 2014) o Manage escalations on a master vendor program for a multi-billion $ technology company (2012 - 2013) o Implementation of Million$+ MSP & RPO solutions to global majors (2011 - 2013) o Lead weekly cadence, senior level vendor engagement, mediate escalations o Train sales & other APME users on automation tools like Salesforce.com, VMS (FieldGlass) and Clarity (2010 - 2014) o Generate APME sales & profitability analysis dashboard and other periodic reports to the top management (2010 - 2013) o Implemented and managed 200+ users for Salesforce.com and creating dashboards for senior mgmt (2010 - 2012)
exp_summary2: The Inside Sales team at Virtusa works in tandem with the global sales force to provide internal clients with enterprise level solutions, such as information, data, numbers and other key figures to complex pursuit requirements. With responsibilities throughout all stages of the sales cycle, from lead generation through to implementation, the Inside Sales team helps drive global sales results and is accountable to meet established targets. In this position, I have the opportunity to interface with multiple teams across the organization, to represent customer and sales force interests, including product satisfaction and general requirements
exp_summary3: Roles and Responsibilities The job responsibilities during this tenure have expanded to a considerable degree varying from managing a team of 10, making Outbound and receiving Inbound calls, communicating via telephone / email / fax and other new marketing strategies to the Corporate and Healthcare industry in USA, UK and INDIA. The profile mainly involves selling Call Center, Medical Billing and Transcription Solutions to large and mid-market companies’, hospitals and clinics and also handling inbound calls regarding the queries on the services and solutions. Making outbound calls to Corporate in USA, UK and to introduce e24 Technologies solutions and assist my Director and Manager in the consecutive business development life cycle processes till the close. Organize and participate in high-level meetings and follow-up on sales calls. Handling inbound calls regarding queries on the services, from large and mid-market Companies. Identifying new sales opportunities and qualifying potential clients from the existing database, market research and also new strategies. Prepare proposals and other high level marketing documents. Develop contents and newsletters for our website, reviewed by the core team. Visit Domestic Prospects for high-level introductory meetings. Manage a team of 10 plus reporting directly to me and help them with their calls, and other day-to-day details.
exp_summary4: Roles and Responsibilities The job responsibilities during this tenure have expanded to a considerable degree varying from making and receiving calls and communicating via telephone / email to the Corporate in US / UK and other countries around the world. It mainly involves selling of Patented Management Solutions to Fortune 1000 and Fortune 500 companies and also handling inbound calls from corporate, regarding queries on the services. Making outbound calls to Corporate in US / UK and other countries around the world and sell E-Mail Based Patented Relationship Management Solutions, by giving 15-20 minute intro about EchoMail, Inc. and take it to next business level. Organize high-level meetings and follow-up on sales calls. Handling inbound calls regarding queries on the services, from very large and mid-market Companies. Identifying new sales opportunities and qualifying potential clients from the existing database and market research. Work on Proposals to validated Clients and being a part of delivering the services to the end clients. Involving with the technical team and respond to RFP’s and RFI’s from interested companies. Follow-Up on Call Me Now and Demo Requests, interested Clients apply on the Company website – Echomail.com Keep track of Tier 1 companies and update marketing activities to our CEO and Chairman. General office administration, which includes faxing, printing, developing daily reports on the software and hardware being used (CRM TOOL – SFA).
exp_summary5: Roles and Responsibilities The job responsibilities during this tenure have expanded to a considerable degree varying from making calls and communicating via telephone to the Medical institutions and doctors in USA. It mainly involved selling of administrative services to Health Care providers and also taking inbound calls from doctors and patients regarding queries on the services and guiding them through the process. Making outbound calls to Doctors in America to sell Medical Billing Services. Following up on sales calls. Handling inbound calls regarding queries on the services from health care providers and patients. Identifying new sales opportunities and qualifying potential clients from the existing database and market research. General office administration, which included faxing, printing, developing daily reports on the software and hardware being used (CRM TOOL – SIMS).
